fields.description: Walking down the thoroughfare, you encounter a group of rough-looking locals shoving a young lad. You hear shouts of "Thief!" and "Show us where you hid it!"
fields.title: A Commotion in the Street

fields.description: A group of deer runs past, keeping a cautious distance but well within sight. Will you pursue them?
fields.title: Swift Stags

fields.description: A battered wooden chest with strong iron clamps rests insolently on the ground. Does it dare keep its treasure from you?
fields.title: A Locked Chest!

fields.description: The skies are clear this evening, and you pause to look at the shimmering lights above. A single bright flash appears long enough for you to trace its path. According to superstition, wishes made in the wake of a star's passing are more likely to come true. For what will you wish?
fields.title: Shooting Star

fields.description: You meet a man who claims to be a master of the ether. For a few coins he will travel with you for the day and share its mysteries with you.
fields.title: Wandering Teacher

fields.description: Some creature has been snacking on your rations! At least, you presume that's the the reason for the hole chewed in your pack, the removal of rations and the addition of crumbs.
fields.title: Vermin!

fields.description: You step into the inviting warmth of a nearby tavern. Ale is flowing, tongues are loosened, and everyone seems to have a tale to tell. To whom will you listen?
fields.title: Tavern Tales

fields.description: A brother and sister call to you for help. They went to market two days earlier, but have not been able to find their way back home. They aren't sure exactly where their home is. Will you help them?
fields.title: Lost Children

fields.description: While hopping from stone to stone over a particularly wide steam, you notice a flash of light from beneath the water. It looks like someone lost their purse while making a similar leap, and now their coins lie under three feet of swiftly rushing water.
fields.title: Coins in the River

fields.description: A local promontory looms over the landscape. Several rough trails seem to offer passage up its slope.
fields.title: To the Mountaintop

fields.description: An irate farmer is trying to get rid of the starlings that have been devouring his berry crop, and will pay you to assist him.
fields.title: Clear the Field

fields.description: Books are precious and rare in Skal, so it's unusual to see them sold this openly. A gaunt man wearing once-respectable clothing offers to part with some of his treasures for a few coins.
fields.title: The Way of the Book

fields.description: A fellow-traveler has reached the respectable age of thirty, and decided to hang up his adventuring sword for good. He's one of the lucky few who chose the right side in their fights, saved their coins, and got out before they were cut down. He and his wife just had their first son, and he intends to collect some memorable artifacts for his child's future.
fields.title: Calling All Adventurers

fields.description: Chase down the slowest of the herd. This will provide plenty of food for your journey!
fields.title: Dinner's On

fields.description: The buck in front sports a magnificent rack. It will be hard to take this one, and doing so will prove your hunting prowess.
fields.title: A Fine Trophy

fields.description: What did the deer ever do to you?
fields.title: Let Them Pass

fields.description: You're outnumbered here. Best to keep quiet and not do anything rash.
fields.title: Observe the Fray

fields.description: Now's the time for action. A swift display of force will make them think twice about their actions.
fields.title: Rescue the Lad

fields.description: In your experience, it doesn't take much to change the focus of an angry mob.
fields.title: Create a Distraction

fields.description: That's what a lockpick is for, right?
fields.title: Pick the Lock

fields.description: May tales of your exploits spread throughout the land!
fields.title: Wish for Fame

fields.description: The world has plenty. You deserve some.
fields.title: Wish for Wealth

fields.description: Many wise men study the stars, so they must have secrets worth knowing.
fields.title: Wish for Wisdom

fields.description: Why strive? Enjoy the time you have.
fields.title: Wish for Happiness

fields.description: Not enough royals for full instruction? For the price of a flagon of ale, he will give you a few tips.
fields.title: A brief lesson

fields.description: Too few people in Skal know the Ether's mysteries, and even fewer are willing to share its secrets. Learn as much as you can from this opportunity.
fields.title: A full course

fields.description: So he thinks he can teach you of the Ether, does he? Let there be a contest of powers between you! The victor shall win a respectable purse with the spoils!
fields.title: A contest

fields.description: Surely the beast will return, and when it does, you shall be ready.
fields.title: Lay a Trap

fields.description: The man leaning against the bar has bright red hair, a bushy beard, and no fingers. He claims to have fought in the Tanalga River War, and have tales that will chill your spine.
fields.title: Listen to a Wounded Veteran

fields.description: Judging from the guffaws emerging from the well-lit corner, this heavy-lidded man is more amusing than he looks.
fields.title: Listen to a Jovial Jokester

fields.description: Several women gathered around a table are exchanging market information in intense but quiet conversation. Such people don't take kindly to interlopers.
fields.title: Listen to the Well-Informed Traders

fields.description: With peoples' attentions so distracted, it would take little effort to relieve them of their burdensome purses.
fields.title: Work the Crowd

fields.description: It may take most of the day, but you can't abide the thought of these children wandering around unattended.
fields.title: Escort them home

fields.description: Your time is valuable! You intend to keep track of the hours spent in the search, so you can politely close up accounts with their father later.
fields.title: Escort them home... for a price

fields.description: Sure, it looks dangerous; that's why their previous owner left them here. A little water's nothing to be afraid of. How about a lot of water?
fields.title: Make a dive

fields.description: No, there's no compelling reason to climb it... but that's not about to stop you!
fields.title: Because It's There

fields.description: If you take your time, you probably won't reach the summit by nightfall... but you will probably enjoy the climb more.
fields.title: Climb Slowly and Carefully

fields.description: The farmer hasn't had much luck with his old shortbow, but perhaps your eyes and reflexes will serve you better. If you can shoot a few of the scavengers, the rest should get the message.
fields.title: Hail of Arrows

fields.description: The stationary scarecrow doesn't seem to be making any impact. Perhaps if you wheel around and holler loudly, you can frighten them off.
fields.title: Flailing and Screaming

fields.description: It feels a little like overkill, but with enough work you should be able to erect a barrier out of the ether that will repel avian intruders.
fields.title: Invisible Dome

fields.description: You've heard that this book's theories have been discredited, but there may still be some worthwhile knowledge hidden amongst the dross.
fields.title: Choose Ethereal Mysteries

fields.description: All the rage when you were growing up, most of this tome's techniques have been well learned by serious swordsmen already, and they are wise to its tricks.
fields.title: Choose an Illustrated Guide to Swordplay

fields.description: No man owning this tome could have ever been truly respectable. This is a guide for aspiring lockpickers, only thinly disguised as a resource for lockbox owners who have thoughtlessly misplaced their keys.
fields.title: Choose Guile's Guide to Locks

fields.description: "I remember well how I stumbled into the adventuring life. I had agreed to help my uncle move some carpets to the fair at a nearby town. Halfway there, we were attacked by highwaymen who had set up a barricade at the crossroads. There were three of them and only one of me, but I don't think they expected a fight! I grabbed the club from their leader's hand, and delivered a beating to the three of them before smashing down that barricade. I remember that there was a sign nearby, with the symbol of a fox standing upright. If you can find that sign, please bring it to me, and I'll pay its weight in copper coin."
fields.title: Locate the Ominous Crossroads

fields.name: Family Legacy
fields.description: You agreed to help a retired adventurer secure objects for his children's future.

fields.title: Graceful and Grateful
fields.description: The beasts quietly move along. You may be imagining things, but you feel like they appreciate your mercy. You also notice how their careful steps avoid crunching any twigs underfoot; following their example may help you if you ever become the hunted.

fields.title: Antlers to Admire
fields.description: On second thought, these are much too large to carry with you. Still, this tale will impress many who hear you tell it.

fields.title: Virtuous Venison
fields.description: The animal leads you on a merry chase, and you pick up a new trick or two during the pursuit. That evening, the meat tastes all the sweeter for the effort you spent.

fields.title: Blood and Coins
fields.description: Ouch, that was unpleasant to see. The mob is busy enough that they fail to notice when their blows knock loose a few coins. You nonchalantly pick up a few that roll your way.

fields.title: The Sword is Mightier than the Pen
fields.description: The first few men don't see what hit them, and the remainder are startled enough to quickly give up the fight. The grateful boy bounds off, but not before giving you a word of appreciation and the incriminating evidence.

fields.title: Aversion
fields.description: It's amazing how quickly a single shout of "Fire!" will disperse a crowd. The boy runs off before you can speak to him. Hopefully he will stay out of trouble in the future.

fields.title: A Fistful of Royals
fields.description: The lock easily yields to your prodding. Most of the contents are worthless, but you glean a few shining coins from the bottom.

fields.title: Whispers on the Wind
fields.description: You later learn that few other people noticed the star. Telling the tale impresses them, a little.

fields.title: Ask and You Shall Receive
fields.description: You certainly didn't expect your wish to be granted so quickly! Your eye catches a glimmer on the ground; groping into the dark, your fingers close around the satisfying weight of a small coin.

fields.title: Few Answers, Many Questions
fields.description: Why do stars fall? Are they really stars at all? A shooting star is a rare sight, but they happen often enough that you would expect the sky to be empty by now. If you were watching a star at the right time, could you trace its fall from the beginning? You pass several quiet minutes studying a portion of sky to memorize the positions of its lights.

fields.title: Contentment
fields.description: You sit on the ground and let the peace of the evening wash over you. Who knows what tomorrow will bring? In this moment, you feel that all is right in the world.

fields.title: Grains of Knowledge
fields.description: "Have you ever walked through a spot and unaccountably felt a shiver? Such feelings occur in places where the ether is especially thin. Outside its customary embrace, you are briefly disconnected from its continuity with the rest of the world. The next time you shiver and do not feel cold, wait there for a moment. Feel what is around you. Try to detect the ether nearby. If you can, try to pull it towards yourself and help fill the void..."

fields.title: Unified Theory of Ether
fields.description: "Well, no, we can't directly observe ether, but we can deduce its existence. Consider the wind: it has enough force to bend a tree! Yet no person has actually seen wind itself. Ether is yet another substance that we can manipulate with our bodies, which in turn can manipulate other objects. You raise a hand to toss a rock at a bottle. You purse your lips to blow your breath into a flower. And ether? Sadly, those... muscles, you might call them, are rarely used, but with enough practice you can make them push out, and create your own wave into ether..."

fields.title: Knockabout
fields.description: While the competition is in good fun, both of you clearly wish to win. You face one another, each standing still, except for flinching when a blow from ether lands on a body. You realize that he is focusing his attacks on your legs, and you shift your attentions to forming a barrier in front of them. Once he exhausts himself with his useless strikes, you counter-attack, sending one knock after another into his chest. He finally concedes the match, and shakes your hand when he hands over the coins.

fields.title: Caught in the Act!
fields.description: Just as you suspected: a rat has been trailing you. From the looks of things, it has grown fat on your largess. The extra size makes it easier to snatch on its next outing. A victory!

fields.title: A Valorous Tale
fields.description: "Ay, that was the war I thought would make me a man. Little did I think it would turn me into an old one! No, I will not tell the tale of how my fingers abandoned my hand, not until I've had more cups in me. I'll tell you instead about General Yorden, how he won his battle and lost his House's war. You see, Yorden was a maceman, and knew better than any how to drive a powerful blow against a weak spot. When he led his audacious crossing over the river and into House Gol territory, nothing could stand in his path. Once he started winning, he couldn't turn back. He ended up deep in Gol land, far in front of his supply lines, and out of touch from the real action back at the river. They say that when Naper sued for peace, he wept all the way home. Let that be a lesson for all: swing hard enough to hit, but not so hard that you can't pull back."

fields.title: A Memorable Verse
fields.description:
There was a Patriarch named Sibold
Whose daughter's ambitions were quite bold
She raised up an army
And marched them to the sea
Then back home before her lunch grew cold

fields.title: Frozen Out
fields.description: If there's one thing you've learned about the wealthy, it's that they despise competition. Try as you might to eavesdrop, they fall silent whenever you wander within range of their discussion.

fields.title: Current Market Prices
fields.description: What luck! It turns out that the middle-aged woman in blue is freshly arrived from the country, and has asked her companions for advice on selling her goods locally. You glean some useful and timely information about the excess supply of wheat flooding the markets, and what goods can earn more coin.

fields.title: Ten for You, and Ten for the House
fields.description: Picking pockets has rarely felt so easy! You gather more than you had expected, and in a fit of generosity, you order a round for the whole tavern. Everyone, including those you have just robbed, cheers you loudly. Best of all, after this display nobody will have the nerve to accuse you of theft!

fields.title: Safe, Sound, and Found
fields.description: The father is overjoyed to see his children home again. "I wish they would stop wandering off like that!" he exclaims. "One of these days, they'll learn their lesson. In the meantime, thanks be that we have good souls like you in the world."

fields.title: Smiles All Around
fields.description: The children are happy to sleep in their beds again. Their father is happy to have them back. You are happy with the new coins in your pocket. Everyone got what they wanted. One could almost wish there were more missing children in the world...

fields.title: Sputtering Riches
fields.description: You set your back on the far shore and dive. The force of the current immediately starts pulling you downstream. Fighting back and down, you plunge towards where you saw the coins. Your grasping hands pull up sand, which flies around and obscures your vision. Reaching out blindly, you cut your palm on an unusually sharp rock, and lose precious breath in an inadvertent yelp of pain. Your other hand fares better, and scoops up most of the coins before you resurface. You drag yourself to the shore, coughing and bleeding, but pleased nonetheless at your bounty.

fields.title: A Stunning View
fields.description: Amazing! While you catch your breath, you look around and drink in the landscape. Lush forests give way to rich fields, and smoke rises from a small hamlet in the distance. A hawk soars below you. People on the road look as small as ants; you wave at them with great gusto.

fields.title: Nature's Puzzles
fields.description: There's so much to learn up here in the sky that you entirely lose track of your goal. You never see those grubs in the lowlands. Several hawks fly below you, giving a rare chance to see the shape of their wings from above. And that blue flower... what's it called, Selese's Tear? It always looks sickly on the plains, but it seems to thrive up here, growing happily in the shade of giant oak trees.

fields.title: Well Shot!
fields.description: Taking down a bird on the wing seems challenging, but it's easier when you aim at a solid group of them. The murmuration of starlings hears the loud squawking of the fallen and beats a hasty retreat. You collect your coins from the impressed farmer, and help yourself to the birds as well.

fields.title: A Scary Sight
fields.description: ... or perhaps they find you too amusing? The starlings seem captivated by your antics, and coalesce from across the sky into a roiling mass over your head. Fortunately, this gives the farmer a perfect opportunity to start tossing small stones at them, and they eventually disperse. You hadn't realized that you were this captivating to living creatures. The farmer grumbles but hands over a few coins for your efforts.

fields.title: Avian Confusion
fields.description:
Working carefully, with your eyes closed, you gently push outward at the ether around you. You move it slowly enough to form a semi-solid threshold. When the next bird dives down to snatch a berry, it makes a pleasing "bonk" sound and bounces off your barrier. It angrily attempts again, as do its fellows, but they eventually realize the hopelessness of their task and fly off.\n
\n
The farmer seems awestruck at your action, and terrified by your presence. He pays you more than you expect and then graciously shoos you off his land.

fields.title: Absurdity
fields.description: It's hard to believe anyone takes this seriously. The author claims that ether is created by superior beings who live in the sky, that one must recite special words in order to tap its powers, that mastering ether allows one to create new animals and predict the future. You don't consider yourself an expert of ether, and even you know this is all false. In fact, you come to the conclusion that several other arguments made by the author are false, and glumly toss the book in the gutter after satisfying your curiosity.

fields.title: Dusty Wisdom
fields.description:
The diagrams within the book are quite useful, albeit rather familiar. They pay particular attention to the basics: the proper grasp, the shapes of various blades, how much to bend one's knees. You don't precisely learn anything new, but it's always helpful to be reminded of fundamentals, especially when they can save your life.\n
\n
A young adventuring lass spies you with the book, and offers to buy it off you. You manage to recoup much of your initial investment.

fields.title: Crevices
fields.description: At first, you are excited by the secrets the book reveals. It looks like the author painstakingly took apart dozens of locks, and carefully illustrated their components. Knowing in advance what one might encounter helps one avoid fumbling around in the dark. Your enthusiasm fades somewhat when you read the author's obsequious fawning over King Seffon; the monarch has been dead for nearly a century, so the vulnerabilities exposed by this tome have probably been corrected in all but the oldest locks you will encounter. You resolve to use the book for kindling the next time you make a campfire.

fields.title: Snatched Sign
fields.description: You deduce that the fox sign must have been erected by Pater Velkin, whose family has used that sigil for generations. It takes a few days of wandering the roads, and you need to chase off a few bandits yourself, but eventually you find it. The sign is smaller than the adventurer described, but he enthusiastically accepts it. "I can't wait for the day I can show this to my boy, and tell him about the first heroic deed done by his father! Come back tomorrow, and I'll have another job for you."
